info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 11:09AM EDT until August 10 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including parks, greenways, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1054 AM EDT, Rainfall has ended across the Charlotte metro and no additional heavy rainfall is expected. However, an earlier round of thunderstorms produced torrential rainfall totaling 1-2" in less than an hour, causing excessive runoff and rapid stream rises. Little Sugar Creek, Briar Creek, and McMullen Creek all remain elevated following earlier heavy rainfall. Little Sugar Creek is currently flooding the Little Sugar Greenway, but it has crested and will continue to recede back below critical levels over the next hour. Expect continued impacts near Medical Center Dr, Hillside Ave, and Archdale Dr. Briar Creek near Shamrock Dr and McMullen Creek at Addison Dr/Lincrest Pl are out of their banks flooding adjacent low- lying areas. Expect shallow flooding of Addison Dr over the next half hour. The headwaters of both creeks are cresting and will begin to recede over the next 30 minutes, falling back within their banks within the next 60-90 minutes. Briar Creek is also out of bank near Independence Blvd, Providence Rd, and Colony Rd, impacting adjacent low-lying areas with nuisance flooding, including along the Briar Creek Greenway and at the Myers Park Country Club. People are urged to stay away from area streams until flood waters recede. Rapid stream flows can quickly sweep you away. - Some locations that may be experiencing flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, East Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, Pineville, Freedom Park, Southpark Mall, The Plaza, The Arboretum and Hidden Valley. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
